data.title: Department of Applied Science Gauhati University.
data.meta_description: Department of Applied Science Gauhati University. Five years Integrated B.Sc. & M.Sc. in Applied Physic, Instrumentation and Applied Physics
data.text:
Department of Applied Science, Gauhati University. Admission in master’s degree Courses, Gauhati University Admission Test, Higher Education Career Options in Assam, Best Science Courses after Degree in Assam

Department Profile of Applied Science Gauhati University.

Year of Establishment 1986.

Course offered:

1. Five years Integrated B.Sc & M.Sc in Applied Physics.

Four Year Undergraduate Program [FYUGP] -B.Sc Major/Honours course with research and 5th-year Integrated one-year M.Sc Course. Course Duration is a maximum of 5 years but have the option to exit from the program as per NEP-2020 Rules.

2. Two Year master’s degree, MSc in Instrumentation and Applied Physics.

The Intake seat capacity is 20. Course Duration 2 years, 4 semesters.

3. Research Ph.D

About the Department of Applied Science.

The Department of Instrumentation & USIC originally started as the University Science Instrumentation Centre (USIC) of Gauhati University in 1978, in the Department of Physics, GU, and become a full-fledged academic department in 1986. The department was renamed as Department of Instrumentation & USIC, Gu in 2005. The Department is under the Faculty of Technology, GU. M.Sc Instrumentation has been renamed as M.Sc in Instrumentation & Applied Physics. The department also offers Ph.D Research Program.

Facilities

Sophisticated Analytical Instrument Facility [SAFI] a national X-ray facility sponsored by the Department of Science and Technology [DST] Govt. of India is located in the Department.

Specialization Offered in Gauhati University

Biomedical instrumentation.

Foreignsic Instrumentation.

Advanced industrial Automation.

Advanced Embedded System.

Job Opportunities in M.Sc Applied Science

An MSc in Applied Science can open up a wide range of job opportunities in various sectors.

Research Scientist: Work in research and development roles in industries like pharmaceuticals, biotechnology, or materials science.

Data Scientist/Analyst: Analyze data to derive insights and make data-driven decisions in fields such as healthcare, finance, or technology.

Environmental Consultant: Assess environmental issues, provide solutions, and ensure compliance with regulations for both public and private sector organizations.

Quality Assurance Specialist: Ensure the quality and compliance of products or processes in industries such as manufacturing or healthcare.

Biomedical Scientist: Conduct research and analysis in healthcare and life sciences, contributing to advancements in medical diagnostics and treatments.

Laboratory Manager: Oversee laboratory operations, manage staff, and ensure the proper functioning of laboratory equipment and procedures.

Forensic Scientist: Analyze evidence and provide expert testimony in criminal investigations.

Science Communicator: Translate complex scientific concepts for the general public through journalism, writing, or multimedia content.

Teaching/Research Assistant: Work in academic institutions, assisting with research projects, and potentially teaching undergraduate students.

Product Development Specialist: Contribute to the creation and improvement of products in industries like food science, engineering, or technology.

Government Scientist: Work for government agencies in various capacities, including regulatory compliance, public health, and environmental management.

Pharmaceutical Sales Representative: Promote and sell pharmaceutical products to healthcare professionals.

Consultant: Provide expert advice to businesses or organizations seeking solutions to scientific or technical challenges.

Health and Safety Officer: Ensure workplace safety and compliance with health and safety regulations.

Market Research Analyst: Analyze market trends and consumer behavior to assist companies in making informed business decisions.
